gurmukhi: ਕੋਟਨਿ ਕੋਟਾਨਿ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਦ੍ਰਿਸਟਿ ਦਰਸ ਮਿਲਿ ਅਤਿ ਅਸਚਰਜ ਮੈ ਹੇਰਤ ਹਿਰਾੲੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Kotani Kotaani Dhiaan Drisati Daras Mili , Ati Asacharaj Mai Hayrat Hiraaay Hai ?
translation: The wondrous and marvellous state that befalls upon a Sikh of the True Guru when he integrates his vision in that of the Lord, defeats millions of other contemplations.

gurmukhi: ਕੋਟਨਿ ਕੋਟਾਨਿ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਮਹਿਮਾ ਮਹਾਤਮ ਨ ਅਲਖ ਲਖਾੲੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Kotani Kotaani Giaan Sabad Surati Mili , Mahimaa Mahaatam N Alakh Lakhaaay Hai ?
translation: The importance of union of Guru's words in the consciousness of a Guru-devoted Sikh is beyond comprehension. That glory and grandeur cannot be reached by the knowledge of millions of books and tomes.

gurmukhi: ਤਿਲ ਕੀ ਅਤੁਲ ਸੋਭਾ ਤੁਲਤ ਨ ਤੁਲਾਧਾਰ ਪਾਰ ਕੈ ਅਪਾਰ ਨ ਅਨੰਤ ਅੰਤ ਪਾੲੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Til Kee Atul Sobhaa Tulat N Tulaadhaara , Paar Kai Apaar N Anant Ant Paaay Hai ?
translation: Even a little glory equivalent to a sesame seed in respect of a Sikh who has achieved union of Guru's words and mind beside keeping his mind focused for a glimpse of the Guru is beyond assessment and evaluation. That grandeur cannot be weighed. Its beyond

gurmukhi: ਕੋਟਨਿ ਕੋਟਾਨਿ ਚੰਦ੍ਰ ਭਾਨ ਜੋਤਿ ਕੋ ੳੁਦੋਤੁ ਹੋਤ ਬਲਿਹਾਰ ਬਾਰੰਬਾਰ ਨ ਅਘਾੲੇ ਹੈ ||੨੬੯||
transliteration: Kotani Kotaani Chandr Bhaan Joti Ko Udotu , Hot Balihaar Baaranbaar N Aghaaay Hai ?269?
translation: As a result of the light effulgence in the Sikh of the Guru who has perpetually practiced in his mind the contemplation on the words of the Guru millions of Moons and Suns go sacrifice unto him again and again. (269)
